db:abstract.db:para: Specifies how to manually animate along a path.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: PathInterpolator provides x, y, and angle information for a particular progress along a path.
In the following example, we animate a green rectangle along a bezier path.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] x : real
db:section.db:para: These properties hold the position of the path at progress.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] angle : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the angle of the path tangent at progress.
Angles are reported clockwise, with zero degrees at the 3 o'clock position.

db:section.db:title: path : Path
db:section.db:para: This property holds the path to interpolate.
For more information on defining a path see the Path documentation.

db:section.db:title: progress : real
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current progress along the path.
Typical usage of PathInterpolator is to set the progress (often via a NumberAnimation), and read the corresponding values for x, y, and angle (often via bindings to these values).
